TITLE: Run CtrlPanel with Docker CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command pulls the latest CtrlPanel Docker image from GitHub Container Registry and runs it. It maps ports 80 and 443 on the host machine to the container and mounts a volume for website files. It requires Docker to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/docker/standalone/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -p 80:80 -p 443:443 -v /path/to/website_files:/var/www/html ghcr.io/ctrlpanel-gg/panel:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running CtrlPanel with Docker
DESCRIPTION: This command sets up CtrlPanel using Docker. It runs the CtrlPanel image, maps ports 8080 and 8443, and names the container 'ctrlpanel'. Requires Docker to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -d -p 8080:80 -p 8443:443 --name ctrlpanel ghcr.io/ctrlpanel-gg/panel:1.0.2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Download Docker Compose file
DESCRIPTION: This command downloads the docker-compose file from the CtrlPanel GitHub repository. It uses curl to download the file and saves it as compose.yaml in the current directory. This file is used for configuring the Docker Compose setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/docker/standalone/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -L -o compose.yaml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/docker/standalone/compose.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create environment file
DESCRIPTION: This command creates an empty env_file file in the same directory as the compose file. This file is used to store environment variables that are used by the Docker Compose setup.  It's necessary for configuring Redis settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/docker/standalone/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
touch env_file
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exporting Translations with Artisan
DESCRIPTION: This command generates the localization files for the specified locale (e.g., 'en' for English). It uses the `translatable:export` Artisan command to scan the project for translatable strings and create or update the corresponding language files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/lang/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: cmd
CODE:
```
php artisan translatable:export en
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Localizing Strings in Laravel
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to add a new translatable string in a Laravel project. The string should be wrapped in the `{{ __('...') }}` Blade directive to enable localization. This directive uses the Laravel translation system to retrieve the appropriate translation based on the current locale.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/lang/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
"New String" -> {{ __('New String') }}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Robots.txt: Disallow All Crawling
DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration file instructs all web crawlers to not crawl any part of the website. This is achieved by setting "User-agent: *" to apply to all crawlers and "Disallow: /" to disallow access to all paths.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/public/robots.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: txt
CODE:
```
User-agent: *
Disallow: /
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Summernote License and Initialization
DESCRIPTION: This snippet displays the Summernote editor's version, copyright, author, and licensing information. It shows that the software is distributed under the MIT license. No dependencies are explicitly mentioned within the snippet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ctrlpanel-gg/panel/blob/main/public/plugins/summernote/lang/summernote-hr-HR.min.js.LICENSE.txt#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
/*! Summernote v0.8.18 | (c) 2013- Alan Hong and other contributors | MIT license */
```
